title: Ethereum ETF Race Gains Steam, Six Asset Managers Filed With SEC - U.Today
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Six asset managers have filed Ethereum (ETH) futures ETFs with the SEC, with deadlines in mid-October. VanEck, ProShares, Grayscale, Bitwise, Roundhill, and Volatility Shares are the companies that have submitted their filings. This is a significant development in the race for Ethereum ETFs, with the potential for $9 trillion asset management giant Blackrock to join the club. The launch of ETFs outside Bitcoin (BTC) is seen as a game-changer for the investment world, as it eliminates the need for physical storage and allows wealth managers to invest in crypto like regular exchange-traded products. The approval of these ETFs could trigger an injection of capital into the cryptocurrency sphere and potentially catalyze a bull run.

title: DeFi Platform Term Finance Brings Fixed Rate Lending to Ethereum - CoinDesk
summary: DeFi platform Term Finance offers fixed rate lending on Ethereum, batching liquidity to improve nascent markets. This approach is similar to the early days of the New York Stock Exchange, where a daily auction was used instead of a continuous market.

title: Term Finance brings fixed-term lending protocol to Ethereum mainnet - Blockworks
summary: Term Finance, a fixed-term lending protocol, is launching on the Ethereum mainnet today, offering non-custodial, fixed-rate lending with collateral using the tri-party repurchase model. Unlike other fixed-term lending protocols, Term Finance uses a double-sided blind auction process, allowing liquidity providers to participate in auctions for a specific period of time and receive a loan if their bid is accepted. This model allows for more scalability and better returns for both borrowers and lenders. The first public auction will be held on wstETH collateral borrowing USDC, with a one-month loan maturing on Aug. 31. The long-term vision is to create a DeFi native benchmark yield curve with repo tokens maturing every week, month, and year.

title: Cardano Founder Champions Superior Transaction Costs Compared to Ethereum - U.Today
summary: Cardano founder Charles Hoskinson has highlighted the lower transaction costs of Cardano compared to Ethereum, citing a recent tweet that showed a transaction of 56 assets on Cardano costing just $0.14. Hoskinson attributed this to Cardano's unique features, such as its extended UTXO model and Plutus smart contract language. He has previously criticized Ethereum's high transaction fees and staking mechanism, suggesting that Cardano's proof-of-stake protocol is more effective. Hoskinson has also described Ethereum as "a dumpster fire" and suggested it could become obsolete.

title: Term Labs Launches Fixed-Rate Lending Protocol on Ethereum - Decrypt
summary: Term Labs has launched a fixed-rate lending protocol on Ethereum called Term Finance, which aims to provide a more mature and familiar lending experience for both lenders and borrowers. The protocol uses a auction calendar model inspired by the US Treasury, where collateral is locked in a smart contract for the duration of the loan. The team hopes to attract investors and traders with low fees and high-quality blue chip collateral such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, and stablecoins. The protocol will expand to other blockchains and layer-2 solutions soon. The most popular lending and borrowing activities on the testnet were borrowing stablecoins against liquid staking tokens and borrowing ETH against LSTs to enhance staking yields. The shortest duration of loan is four weeks, but the most popular terms are expected to be 1-3 months.

title: Ethereum Name Service: Whale causes flurry amidst July dip - AMBCrypto News
summary: Ethereum Name Service (ENS) experienced a flurry of activity on July 31, with a whale reclaiming 44.14 million ETH worth $74.17 million, after 2.7 years of dormancy. The owner of the darkmarket.eth domain reclaimed their ETH two years after ENS founder and lead developer Nick Johnson reminded them of the funds' lockup. The whale then transferred over $119 million in ETH to a new wallet. ENS's market cap in BTC terms and monthly name registrations have been declining, with a 14% fall in July and a 45% drop on a year-to-date basis. New addresses created on the ENS network also experienced a decline in July, with only 25,115 new addresses created. Monthly revenue from new registrations and renewals has been declining since January, with a 52% fall in new registrations and a 2% fall in name renewals. The altcoin traded at $9.50 at press time, with day traders showing little enthusiasm for

title: Will Ethereum (ETH) Break The $2000 Mark in August? Should You Buy (Ethereum) ETH Now? - Analytics Insight
summary: Will Ethereum (ETH) reach $2000 in August? Experts suggest it could, but there are other promising projects like Pikamoon (PIKA) to consider. Pikamoon is a GameFi project with high demand and growth potential, supported by top investors and built on two blockchains. The ongoing presale has already amassed nearly $4 million in sales and experts predict a 10,000% increase by the end of the year. Consider buying $PIKA for potential profits. Find more information at <https://pikamoon.io/>.

title: Bitcoin Takes a Backseat, Ethereum and XRP Dominate July's Crypto Market: Report - CoinGape
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Bitcoin and Ethereum saw price drops in July, while XRP surged following an SEC lawsuit victory. Ethereum showed resilience, gaining 4.9% against Bitcoin. XRP emerged as a big winner, posting a 42% return. Other gainers included Stellar, Maker, and XinFin. However, there were low whale transactions, indicating reluctance among important stakeholders. The market capitalization of Bitcoin has been falling, and the general mood of the market has shifted from "greed" to "neutral".

title: Ethereum co-founder enjoys ‘ghevar cake’ in Bengaluru on crypto's 8th birthday - Hindustan Times
summary: Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin was spotted in Bengaluru on the 8th anniversary of the cryptocurrency, where he enjoyed Indian sweet ghevar as a birthday cake. Nailwal, co-founder of Polygon, shared images of Buterin's visit and extended birthday wishes to Ethereum. Buterin's visit also included a brief tour of India, known as "Bharat Darshanam." In 2021, Buterin donated $1 billion worth of Shiba Inu cryptocurrency coins to a Covid relief fund, but only 5% could be used to support Covid efforts in India due to Indian laws. Ethereum has become the second largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization, and cryptocurrency exchange Kraken has resolved issues with Ethereum's funding gateway.

title: Crypto Price Today: Bitcoin breached $29,000; Ethereum below $1,850; Solana & Polygon fall 5% each - Business Today
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Bitcoin and other top crypto tokens are trading lower, with altcoins falling sharply. The crypto market is experiencing selling pressure, with the fear and greed index climbing 3 points to 53/100. Bitcoin has breached $29,000 and Ethereum is below $1,850. All top crypto tokens are trading lower, with Cardano, Litecoin, and Polkadot declining 4% each. The global cryptocurrency market cap has fallen to $1.16 trillion, with total trading volumes surging 17% to $30.15 billion. The crypto market is in a consolidation phase due to a lack of major macroeconomic news.

title: Ethereum Co-Founder Relishes Ghevar, Masala Dosa In Bengaluru. See Pics - NDTV
summary: Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, celebrated the cryptocurrency's 8th birthday in Bengaluru with Indian delicacies like ghevar cake and masala dosa. He also visited India to support COVID-19 relief efforts in 2021, donating $1 billion worth of Shiba Inu cryptocurrency coins to a Covid relief fund. However, only 5% of the donation was utilized for Covid relief in India due to the volatile nature of the meme coins.

title: XRP20 Presale Goes Live On Ethereum – The ‘Next Evolution’ Of XRP With Staking - CoinGape
summary: XRP20, a new cryptocurrency project, has launched its presale today, August 1st, with a goal to provide a more user-focused and accessible token. Built on the Ethereum blockchain, XRP20 aims to combine low market cap with high ROI potential and a long-term roadmap, including staking rewards and a burn mechanism. The project has a total supply of 100 billion tokens, with 40% allocated to the presale, 40% to staking rewards, and 10% to exchange liquidity. The presale soft cap is $1.85 million, and the hard cap is $3.68 million. XRP20 is not affiliated with Ripple and is intended for speculation, with its low market cap and high upside potential. The project has already attracted attention from several crypto influencers and is trending on social media. To stay up-to-date on the project's progress, follow the official Twitter account @XRP20_coin and join the Telegram group.

title: Can Ethereum Classic reach $50 after the recent rally? Meanwhile, Tradecurve leads the DeFi market expansion - Techpoint Africa
summary: Ethereum Classic (ETC) is experiencing a rally, with its price testing resistance levels near $23.00 (200 EMA) three times in the recent market rally. Crypto analysts believe the price could rally above this level, potentially reaching $40. Additionally, ETC is optimistic about major developments, including optimizing mining pools, which could lead to the coin hitting $50 in 2023. Meanwhile, Tradecurve (TCRV) is leading the DeFi market expansion with its unique hybrid trading platform, which will allow users to access and trade financial instruments from the global derivatives market with only one account. The token's price is currently trading at $0.025 in its fifth presale stage and is expected to reach $0.029 in the coming week, with long-term predictions pegging the price at $1.5 by the end of 2023.

title: Ethereum DeFi TVL Down $3.55B Since Curve Crisis - Ethereum World News
summary: Ethereum DeFi TVL (Total Value Locked) has decreased by $3.55B since the Curve crisis, with the majority of the decline occurring since Sunday. Curve founder Michael Egorov has sold $15M worth of CRV (Curve tokens) in over-the-counter (OTC) deals to investors and entities, including Tron founder Justin Sun and market maker DWF Labs. These deals include 3-6 month lock-up terms. Egorov's move is believed to be an attempt to prevent liquidation of his $60M on Aave collateralized by $175M in CRV tokens, which could trigger a domino effect of bad debt across DeFi lending services. The decline in CRV price has been attributed to factory exploits on Curve Finance liquidity pools.

title: Unitas Protocol Goes Live on Ethereum Mainnet: Mint Unitized Stablecoins with USDT - Yahoo Canada Finance
summary: Unitas Protocol, a decentralized finance (DeFi) platform, has launched on the Ethereum mainnet, allowing users to mint unitized stablecoins pegged to emerging market currencies. The platform, developed by Unitas Foundation, aims to provide stablecoin liquidity to emerging markets and bridge the gap between USD stablecoins and local currencies. Unitized stablecoins are denominated in local currencies but are backed by USD stablecoins, providing users with guaranteed USD liquidity. The protocol has launched with four initial unitized stablecoins, including USD91 (INR-pegged), USD971 (AED-pegged), USD84 (VND-pegged), and USD1 (USD-pegged).

title: Industry Still Isn’t Close to Solving the Blockchain Trilemma: Offchain Labs Chief Strategy Officer - Decrypt
summary: The article discusses the ongoing challenge of solving the blockchain trilemma, which refers to the trade-off between scalability, security, and decentralization in blockchain networks. Despite the progress made in each of these areas, the industry is still far from finding a solution that can simultaneously improve all three. Offchain Labs, a blockchain development firm, is working on a rollup-based network called Arbitrum, which aims to scale Ethereum by offloading some of its workload to external validators. However, the team acknowledges that they are still far from solving the trilemma and that a more efficient solution would be needed to replace traditional payment heavyweights like Mastercard or Visa. The article highlights the importance of permissionless validation, which would allow users to challenge invalid state transitions without relying on a centralized authority, as a key area of research and development in this field.

title: Ethereum Network Metrics Light Up, Good Sign For August? - Bitcoinist
summary: Ethereum network metrics have shown a positive trend, with an increase in daily active addresses and network growth. This could be a good sign for the asset in August. The number of daily active addresses has reached its highest level in two weeks, with over 450,000 addresses participating in transaction activity. Additionally, new addresses are being created at a rate of over 80,000. This increased user activity could lead to volatility in the price, although the direction is uncertain. The ETH price is currently trading around $1,800, down 1% in the last week.

title: Sam Altman's Worldcoin and Bitcoin Spark set to outpace Solana and Ethereum in 2023 | Bitcoinist.com - Bitcoinist
summary: Bitcoin Spark (BTCS) and Worldcoin (WLD) are set to outperform Solana (SOL) and Ethereum (ETH) in 2023 due to their innovative technologies and solutions to the crypto industry's challenges. Bitcoin Spark is a new fork of the Bitcoin blockchain that uses a new mining system called "Proof-Of-Process" (PoP) to make mining more accessible and fair. Worldcoin, on the other hand, uses iris scanning to create a unique digital identity and financial network owned by everyone. While Ethereum is expected to recover and thrive due to its unique model, scalability solutions, and leadership in dApps, Solana's price prediction is optimistic, indicating that its value is expected to appreciate over time.
